intro: Hepatica acuta, commonly known as acute liverwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of down. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, appearing in early spring. Hepatica acuta thrives in moist, shaded woodland habitats and is often found in the understory of forests. It is a herbaceous perennial that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable conditions.
